excerpt: Iconic seaside promenade with luxury shops, hotels & eateries, home to the famous film festival.
detail_description: Bd de la Croisette, also known as the Boulevard la Croisette, is a renowned seaside promenade in Cannes. It has a rich history, originally following an ancient seaside road and now famous for hosting events like the Festival International du Film. The boulevard is lined with luxury shops, high-end hotels, and exquisite dining options.
name: Bd de la Croisette

excerpt: Charming, medieval Le Suquet is home to steep cobbled alleys, Marché Forville’s food stalls, and candy-colored cottages winding inland from Vieux Port’s yacht-filled marina. Hilltop Château de la Castre’s museum displays Riviera landscape art, and Gothic-style Notre-Dame d'Espérance church offers sweeping views over the Bay of Cannes. Jazz bars, indie stores, and bistros serving Provençal dishes line the streets.
detail_description: Le Suquet, the historic center of Cannes, is a charming medieval district with steep cobbled alleys and colorful cottages. It is home to Marché Forville's food stalls and offers sweeping views over the Bay of Cannes from the Gothic-style Notre-Dame d'Espérance church. The area also features the hilltop Château de la Castre's museum showcasing Riviera landscape art.
name: Le Suquet

excerpt: Local produce & flowers are the focus of this indoor market that also sells seafood, cheese & more.
detail_description: Marché Forville is a bustling indoor market located at the base of ancient Le Suquet in Cannes. It offers a wide variety of local produce, flowers, seafood, cheese, and more. The market is open six days a week and transforms into an antiques market on Mondays. Visitors can explore the colorful stalls filled with florists, cheesemongers, fishmongers, bakeries, and other food vendors offering continental delicacies.
name: Marché Forville
address: 6 Rue du Marché Forville, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: Rue d'Antibes is a bustling street located in the heart of Cannes, known for its prime location between the famous Croisette and the Palais des Festivals. It's surrounded by shops, restaurants, and hotels like Le Cristal Hotel & Spa, making it an ideal spot for visitors to explore and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of this popular area.
name: Rue d'Antibes

excerpt: Modern, multi-story convention center hosting high-profile events like the Cannes Film Festival.
detail_description: The Palace of Festivals and Congresses of Cannes is a modern convention center that hosts prestigious events like the Cannes Film Festival. Adjacent to it is the historical Church of Lady of Good Voyage, which replaced the original chapel and holds significance as Emperor Napoleon's first stop upon his return from Elba in 1815. Additionally, visitors can enjoy free movie screenings on Mace Plage beach every night, courtesy of Cinema de la Plage.
name: Palace of Festivals and Congresses of Cannes
address: Palais des Festivals et des Congrès, 1 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: Lérins Islands, located in the bay of Cannes, are a picturesque escape just 15 minutes away from the old port. The islands offer a blend of nature, spirituality, heritage, and vineyards. Visitors can explore the remnants of a medieval castle that once served as a base for monks on one of the islands. The area also boasts prestigious collections at a museum situated on the heights of Le Suquet with stunning panoramic views.
name: Lérins Islands

excerpt: Accessible by ferry from Cannes, this small island features beaches, an old fort & Riviera views.
detail_description: Île Sainte-Marguerite is a charming small island located just a ferry ride away from Cannes. It boasts beautiful beaches and an ancient fort, offering stunning views of the French Riviera. The island is also home to La Guerite, a renowned establishment since 1902, where visitors can enjoy exquisite dining experiences surrounded by lush Aleppo pine and eucalyptus trees.
name: Île Sainte-Marguerite

excerpt: Cannes, a resort town on the French Riviera, is famed for its international film festival. Its Boulevard de la Croisette, curving along the coast, is lined with sandy beaches, upmarket boutiques and palatial hotels. It’s also home to the Palais des Festivals et des Congrès, a modern building complete with red carpet and Allée des Étoiles  – Cannes’ walk of fame.
detail_description: Cannes is a luxurious resort town located on the French Riviera, renowned for hosting the prestigious international film festival. The Boulevard de la Croisette runs along the coast and features beautiful sandy beaches, upscale shops, and grand hotels. The Palais des Festivals et des Congrès is a modern building that hosts the film festival and includes Cannes' own walk of fame, Allée des Étoiles.
name: Cannes

excerpt: Leafy island in the Lérins group featuring the remains of a 15th-c., fortified Cistercian monastery.
detail_description: Île Saint-Honorat is a picturesque island in the Lérins group, known for its 15th-century fortified Cistercian monastery. The island is covered with vineyards and is home to some of France's last winemaking monks. Visitors can taste and purchase award-winning wines at a special degustation room and enjoy a meal at a high-quality restaurant.
name: Île Saint-Honorat

excerpt: 19th-century Riviera landscape art, musical instruments & ethnographical items in a medieval tower.
detail_description: Nestled on a picturesque hill that offers stunning views of the Bay of Cannes, the Musée des Explorations du Monde is a treasure trove for art and history enthusiasts. Housed in a medieval castle that once served as a monastery for Lerins monks, this museum showcases an impressive array of artifacts ranging from 19th-century Riviera landscape paintings to ethnographic items and musical instruments.
name: Musée des explorations du monde
address: 6 Rue de la Castre, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Hilltop Gothic-style stone church completed in the 1600s, featuring a musical crèche & city views.
detail_description: Perched atop Le Suquet Hill in Cannes, Église Notre-Dame d'Espérance, also known as Lady of Hope Church, is a Gothic-style stone church dating back to the early 1600s. This historical landmark offers visitors a serene escape from the bustling city below. The interior boasts a blend of Gothic and Renaissance architecture, adorned with statues and fine wood paneling. Two chapels dedicated to craftsmen's brotherhoods add character to the church's ambiance.
name: Église Notre-Dame d'Espérance
address: 1 Rue de la Castre, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Popular city beach with chair & umbrella rentals, mountain views & close amenities including dining.
detail_description: Plage du Midi is a vibrant city beach that perfectly captures the essence of Cannes. This long stretch of sandy shoreline offers both public and private areas, making it an ideal spot for everyone from families to sun-seekers. Easily accessible from various transport links, Plage du Midi features beach clubs at one end while providing ample space for relaxation further down the shore. Visitors can enjoy activities like beach volleyball or indulge in watersports, all under the watchful eyes of lifeguards.
name: Plage du Midi

excerpt: Built in the 1950s, this picturesque port for boats & yachts is in the heart of Cannes.
detail_description: IGY Vieux-Port de Cannes is a charming port nestled in the heart of Cannes, dating back to the 1950s. It is a picturesque setting for boats and luxury yachts, with stunning sailboats and traditional yachts competing in the annual Royal Regatta held in September. The port offers breathtaking views of the old town of Cannes, featuring colorful facades and occasionally vibrant fishing boats. Additionally, it serves as a link between the glamorous Cannes and its authentic counterpart.
name: IGY Vieux-Port de Cannes

detail_description: Villa Domergue, a stunning manor house located in the hills above Cannes, was built in 1934 by the renowned French painter Jean-Gabriel Domergue. The villa showcases his artwork and that of his wife, Odette Maudrange-Domergue. Inspired by Venetian palaces, the property combines modern and old-world charm. The terraced gardens designed by Odette offer breathtaking views of the bay below.
name: Villa Domergue

excerpt: Art gallery housed in a former hotel showcasing solo exhibitions of 20th- & 21st-century artists.
detail_description: La Malmaison is an art gallery located in a former hotel that features solo exhibitions of 20th- and 21st-century artists. The city of Cannes is investing 80 million euros in major projects, including the modernization of La Malmaison art center, to enhance the city's appeal. The gallery is part of a tour that includes notable buildings such as Musee de la Castre and St. Michael the Archangel Church.
name: La Malmaison
address: 47 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: The avenues of upscale La Croix des Gardes are lined with opulent villas and wend up into forested hills. Hiking trails in the Croix des Gardes nature park have viewpoints looking over the Bay of Cannes and the Estérel Massif mountains. The gardens of the elegant 19th-century Villa Rothschild are open for strolls on palm-shaded paths. Hip bars and clubs line the Riviera beaches near palm-filled Square Mistral.
detail_description: La Croix des Gardes is an upscale area in Cannes, featuring opulent villas and forested hills with hiking trails offering stunning views of the Bay of Cannes and the Estérel Massif mountains. The 19th-century Villa Rothschild's elegant gardens are open for leisurely strolls along palm-shaded paths. This national park spans over 200 acres and boasts a giant cross at its highest point.
name: La Croix des Gardes

detail_description: The Cannes Yachting Festival at Vieux Port is an annual event that takes place in September, making it a significant fixture on the global yachting calendar. It showcases a stunning array of luxurious and high-end boats from across Europe, offering attendees the opportunity to admire these magnificent vessels firsthand.
name: Cannes Yachting Festival - Vieux Port

detail_description: Le Chemin Des Etoiles in Cannes is a must-visit for astronomy enthusiasts, stargazers, nature lovers, outdoor explorers, and romantic couples. It's a replica of Hollywood's Walk of Fame featuring the handprints and signatures of renowned international film stars. Located between Esplanade Pompidou and the Palais des Festivals, this pathway showcases the imprints left by famous actors and singers.
name: Le Chemin Des Etoiles
address: Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: Le Suquet, the historic heart of Cannes, is a charming neighborhood that offers a glimpse into the city's rich past. Nestled near the Old Port and close to Marche Forville, this picturesque area is known for its narrow, winding streets that ascend Chevalier Hill. As you stroll through Le Suquet, you'll encounter beautifully preserved houses adorned with pastel colors and wrought iron balconies that evoke memories of local fishermen returning home after long voyages at sea.
name: Le Suquet, old quarter of Cannes

excerpt: Sculptor Henry Clews bought and rebuilt this chateau in 1918. It now houses an arts hub & museum.
detail_description: Château de la Napoule, originally bought and reconstructed by sculptor Henry Clews in 1918, is now a vibrant arts center and museum. The Musee de la Castre, situated atop Suquet Hill, offers stunning city views and houses a collection of ancient artifacts within its historic castle walls. Visitors can explore the beautiful castle gardens for a small fee or opt for a guided tour of the interior.
name: Château de la Napoule

detail_description: Located in Cannes, France, Casino Barriere Le Croisette is a popular destination for gaming and leisure. The casino boasts an array of offerings including 245 slot machines, electronic English roulette stations, poker tables, and blackjack tables. Additionally, patrons can partake in various table games such as blackjack, roulette, Sic Bo, poker, Punto Banco, and War. The venue also hosts poker tournaments throughout the year.
name: Casino Barriere Le Croisette

excerpt: Fortress with prison cells & Roman relics at the Museum of the Iron Mask & the Royal Fort.
detail_description: The Royal Fort, located on the larger island of Ile Sainte-Margueritte, is a historical fortress built by Vauban. The fort complex includes a museum showcasing Roman relics and the infamous Museum of the Iron Mask. Visitors can also explore the Museum of the Sea, which exhibits archaeological findings from both land and ocean excavations. Additionally, there are prison cells and a church within the fort complex, each with its own unique history.
name: Royal Fort

excerpt: Chic restaurant offering seafood, grilled meats & cocktails in a laid-back beachside atmosphere.
detail_description: The Carlton Beach Club is a chic restaurant located in Cannes, offering a laid-back beachside atmosphere and serving seafood, grilled meats, and cocktails. The venue is known for its vibrant ambiance and is a popular spot throughout the day. With friendly staff and a variety of unique cocktails and regional wines available, it's an ideal place to unwind by the beach. The Carlton Terrace is particularly famous for its lively atmosphere, where guests can enjoy drinks while watching the stars descend upon the red carpet.
name: Carlton Beach Club
address: 58 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Refined rooms in a landmark luxury hotel with posh dining & a spa, plus a pool & a private beach.
detail_description: Hotel Barrière Le Majestic Cannes is a luxurious landmark hotel located right on La Croisette, offering stunning views of the Mediterranean and the red carpet during the Cannes Film Festival. With 349 rooms, including 92 suites, it can host around 700 guests at peak occupancy. The hotel's prime location allows easy access to the town's shops and the beach.
name: Hotel Barrière Le Majestic Cannes
address: 10 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: The Festival International du Film Ecologique et Social Cannes (FIFES) is a prestigious event that has been a significant part of the film industry since its inception in 1946. It attracts renowned movie stars from across the globe and is known for its annual red-carpet gala, which has garnered international acclaim for celebrating the art of filmmaking. The festival is described as committed, human, and inclusive, offering an inspiring program that connects individuals to the transition network.
name: Festival International du Film Ecologique et Social Cannes ( FIFES )

excerpt: Long, public stretch of sand running alongside Cannes' iconic seaside boardwalk, La Croisette.
detail_description: Located alongside the iconic La Croisette boardwalk in Cannes, Croisette Beach is a popular public stretch of sand with a rich history. The area is famous for hosting various congresses and events at the Palais des Festivals, including the renowned International Film Festival. Visitors can also enjoy tours on Le Train du Cinema, exploring attractions like Cannes old town and the Provencal market. Croisette Beach itself offers a spacious sandy shore catering to all visitors, including those with special needs.
name: Croisette Beach Cannes

excerpt: Fine dining and a chic cocktail bar in an elegant hotel with sea views, a private beach & free WiFi.
detail_description: Hôtel Martinez - The Unbound Collection by Hyatt is an elegant hotel located on La Croisette in Cannes, offering stunning sea views and a private beach. The hotel features 411 rooms and suites designed with an Art Deco aesthetic, including a penthouse that ranks as one of the largest hotel suites in Europe. Renovated in 2018 by Pierre-Yves Rochon, the property boasts fine dining options and a chic cocktail bar.
name: Hôtel Martinez - The Unbound Collection by Hyatt
address: 73 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Circa 11th-century monastery on an island that has been home to monks since the 5th century.
detail_description: Abbaye de Lérins is an 11th-century monastery located on Saint-Honorat Island, which has been inhabited by monks since the 5th century. The island is also known for its heritage buildings from Lerins Abbey and a Monastery Tower dating back to the 14th century. Today, it is home to 21 Cistercian monks who continue centuries-old traditions of cultivating and producing renowned wines and liqueurs using local methods.
name: Abbaye de Lérins

detail_description: Les Murs Peints - Cinéma Cannes is a must-see attraction in Cannes, offering a fantastic view of the city and a tribute to the film industry. This free outdoor art display is easily spotted on the way up the hill to the museum, featuring an impressive wall painting that captures the essence of cinema. It's a great spot for photography enthusiasts to hone their skills while admiring this unique street art.
name: Les Murs Peints - Cinéma Cannes

detail_description: Rue Meynadier, located near the Forville market and Suquet in Cannes, is a historic street known for its diverse commerce. Initially focused on food trade, it now hosts a variety of shops including the renowned Tesi hat shop. This charming Provencal alleyway has evolved into a hub for unique shopping experiences, offering gourmet specialties and souvenir options that cater to discerning shoppers.
name: Rue Meynadier

detail_description: Mairie de Cannes, also known as Hotel De Ville or City Hall in English, is a grand town hall designed by Cannes architect Louis Hourlier and completed in 1877. The building showcases early French Third Republic architecture and features an ornate clock face under a mansard roof. Adjacent to it is Hourlier's bandstand, which was erected in 1880 with improved acoustics.
name: Mairie de Cannes
address: 1 Pl. Bernard Cornut Gentille, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Bayfront property offering upscale rooms & suites with free Wi-Fi, plus a private beach & a spa.
detail_description: Nestled along the stunning bayfront, Carlton Cannes, a Regent Hotel, is a luxurious retreat that has recently undergone an impressive transformation. This iconic establishment boasts upscale rooms and suites equipped with complimentary Wi-Fi, alongside exclusive amenities like a private beach and an indulgent spa. After years of restoration work, guests can now enjoy seven new opulent studios and a penthouse within its expansive grounds.
name: Carlton Cannes, a Regent Hotel
address: 58 Bd de la Croisette Cs 40052, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: Cannes, located between the suburb of La Bocca and Moure Rouge, boasts expansive public beaches that are free to access. Additionally, there are two municipal beaches, Zamenhoff and Mace, where visitors can rent lounge chairs, umbrellas, and lockers at a fraction of the cost of private beaches. The city's old town features the medieval Chateau de la Castre atop a hilly area with stunning views of Cannes and its bay.
name: Cannes
address: 4 Pl. de la Gare, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Théoule-sur-Mer, popularly known as Théoule, is a resort village in the Alpes-Maritimes department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in Southeastern France. It lies to the east of the Esterel Massif, on the French Riviera. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Théoule-sur-Mer, also known as Théoule, is a charming resort village located in the Alpes-Maritimes department of the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in Southeastern France. Nestled to the east of the stunning Esterel Massif on the French Riviera, this small coastal town is conveniently close to Cannes. The picturesque harbor is at the heart of local life and is surrounded by beautiful beaches and a rugged red-rock coastline.
name: Théoule-sur-Mer

excerpt: This popular, sandy city beach offers swimming, sunbathing & volleyball, as well as nearby eateries.
detail_description: Plage de la Bocca, located in Cannes, is a popular sandy city beach that offers various activities such as swimming, sunbathing, and volleyball. It is known for its laid-back atmosphere and is less crowded compared to other beaches in the area. The beach has easy access and features golden fine sand and turquoise water. While it can get crowded during the peak season, there are nearby eateries and free parking available.
name: Plage de la Bocca

detail_description: Port de Cannes is a bustling and famous harbor located on the glistening Mediterranean Sea. It boasts an impressive array of luxurious yachts and vessels, creating a mesmerizing sight for visitors. The area is lined with modern cafes, pubs, and restaurants, offering a vibrant atmosphere for tourists to enjoy. Despite some challenges with accessibility, the port offers neat and tidy surroundings with well-organized facilities. Visitors can expect to see private yachts from around the world while enjoying beautiful views of the sea.
name: Port de Cannes - Service Trade
address: Port de Cannes CCI Côte d'Azur Service Commerce Promenade de la Pantiero, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: Cannes Old Town Suites, located in the historic Le Suquet neighborhood, offers a glimpse into the city's origins as a quaint fishing village. Visitors can climb the 109 steps leading to Le Suquet for stunning views and explore the old fortress, now Musee de la Castre. The area boasts ancient walls, narrow staircases, and an eleventh-century watchtower. Guests staying in luxury hotels can enjoy picturesque views of the harbor from private balconies.
name: Cannes Old Town Suites

detail_description: Château de la Castre is a captivating tourist spot with stunning architecture, vibrant colors, and breathtaking views of Cannes. It offers plenty of photo opportunities and a rich historical atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the delicious local cuisine and the friendly, welcoming locals add to the enjoyable experience. The castle itself is majestic and provides a great view over the port of Cannes.
name: Château de la Castre

detail_description: La Croix des Gardes is a picturesque natural area located in Cannes, France. It offers stunning panoramic views of the city and the Mediterranean Sea. The area is known for its beautiful hiking trails that wind through lush greenery and fragrant pine forests. Visitors can also explore the historic sites and monuments scattered throughout La Croix des Gardes, adding a cultural element to their outdoor adventure.
name: La Croix des Gardes

detail_description: Begin your journey in the city and make your way to Croix des Gardes Park. Enjoy stunning views of Cannes as you wander through beautiful plants and mimosas, soaking in the tranquility. Take a different path back through the city to complete your peaceful excursion.
name: Croix des gardes
address: 56 Av. de la Croix des Gardes, 06400 Cannes, France

name: Gate vieux port old harbor
address: 38 Prom. de la Pantiero, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: La Californie, situated in Cannes, is a highly desirable residential area known for its proximity to the city center and stunning vistas of the Esterel mountains, Cap d'Antibes, and the Lerins Islands. This exclusive neighborhood has become a retreat for affluent individuals and celebrities seeking privacy and luxury.
name: La Californie

excerpt: Polished hotel featuring a steakhouse & a cocktail lounge, plus meeting space & a rooftop pool.
detail_description: The JW Marriott Cannes is a luxurious hotel located in the heart of Croisette, offering a perfect blend of modern amenities and classic elegance. With 261 well-appointed rooms, guests can enjoy a beachfront location with easy access to sandy beaches and upscale shops. The hotel features a steakhouse, cocktail lounge, and restaurant, as well as meeting spaces and a rooftop pool with stunning views. Additionally, visitors can explore nearby attractions such as La Croisette promenade and the urban Bay of Cannes.
name: JW Marriott Cannes
address: 50 Bd de la Croisette, 06400 Cannes, France

excerpt: Dedicated to French artist Pierre Bonnard, this museum in a Belle Epoque mansion offers a gift shop.
detail_description: Located in a charming Belle Epoque mansion, Musée Bonnard is a tribute to the renowned French artist Pierre Bonnard. It is the only museum in the world dedicated to him and showcases his works from when he lived in Le Cannet. The museum also features pieces by his contemporaries, offering insight into art during the early 1900s. Visitors can explore the gallery's small but delightful collection and even purchase souvenirs at its gift shop.
name: Musée Bonnard
address: 16 Bd Sadi Carnot, 06110 Le Cannet, France

excerpt: Now a public library, this grand 19th-century estate has manicured grounds with walking paths.
detail_description: Médiathèque Noailles, also known as The Noailles Media Library in English, is a stunning 19th-century estate located just a short drive from Cannes. The manicured grounds feature walking paths and an array of themed gardens including Japanese, desert, tropical, classical, and old-style European gardens. Visitors can enjoy the timed fountains set to classical music and breathtaking views of the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Médiathèque Noailles
address: 1 Av. Jean de Noailles, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: The Plage Macé beach in La Croisette is a great place to relax and swim. It's free to use, has clean water, and is usually quiet in the morning. There are no rocks or wind here, which makes it a calm and safe spot. The only downside is that there are not many places to sit down, so it can get crowded during the summer months.
name: Plage Macé
Parc naturel forestier de la Croix des Gardes

detail_description: Cimetière du Grand Jas is an extraordinary cemetery with unique features, including small chapels adorned with flowers and a sublime statue of a sorrowful woman on Annina Gagarin's tomb. It has been in existence since the late 19th century and covers a vast area of 9 hectares. The cemetery is home to magnificent statues, moving epitaphs, and distinct districts such as Russian, English, Jewish, and squares dedicated to fighters from various wars.
name: Cimetière du Grand Jas

detail_description: The Musée Chapelle Bellini is a beautiful chapel with its wonderful Lucette who will teach you about various artworks and their different evolutions over the years 30 to 70.
name: Musée Chapelle Bellini
address: 67 bis avenue de Vallauris, All. du Parc Fiorentina, 06400 Cannes, France

detail_description: St. Michael the Archangel Church, located on Boulevard Alexander III in Cannes, is a must-visit for those interested in religious landmarks. The church offers a serene and sacred ambiance that leaves visitors inspired and filled with a sense of reverence. Additionally, the Bellini Chapel in Fiorentina Park showcases Italian Baroque style and houses paintings by local artist Emmanuel Bellini and his daughter Lucetta.
name: St. Michael the Archangel Church
